intro: Platymiscium pinnatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves that are opposite and pinnately compound. The plant has small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, fleshy berries. It typically grows on the branches of other trees, drawing water and nutrients from its host. Its botanical features make it an important component of the forest ecosystem in its native habitat.
